alert.note: Alert for Tillamook (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 2:19PM PST until December 27 at 11:05PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Portland OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oregon... Wilson River near Tillamook affecting Tillamook County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wilson River near Tillamook. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late this evening. * IMPACTS...Above 12.0 feet, minor flooding of low lying dairy and pasture land north and east of Tillamook can be expected, particularly during high tides. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.2 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 8 PST.
